Sentencas: Repeated reduction and oxidation of metallic nickel in the anodes of solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC) causes volume changes and agglomeration.
Titulo: Improved Redox Cycling Durability in Alternative Ni Alloy-Based SOFC Anodes

Sentencas: This disrupts the electron conducting network, resulting in deterioration of the electrochemical performance.
Titulo: Improved Redox Cycling Durability in Alternative Ni Alloy-Based SOFC Anodes

Sentencas: It is therefore desirable to develop more robust anodes with high redox stability.
Titulo: Improved Redox Cycling Durability in Alternative Ni Alloy-Based SOFC Anodes

Sentencas: Here, new cermet anodes are developed, based on nickel alloyed with Co, Fe, and/or Cr.
Titulo: Improved Redox Cycling Durability in Alternative Ni Alloy-Based SOFC Anodes

Sentencas: The stable phases of these different alloys are calculated for oxidizing and reducing conditions, and their electrochemical characteristics are evaluated.
Titulo: Improved Redox Cycling Durability in Alternative Ni Alloy-Based SOFC Anodes

Sentencas: Whilst alloying causes a slight decrease in power generation efficiency, the Ni-alloy based anodes have significantly improved redox cycle durability.
Titulo: Improved Redox Cycling Durability in Alternative Ni Alloy-Based SOFC Anodes

Sentencas: Microstructural observation reveals that alloying results in the formation of a dense oxide film on the surface of the catalyst particle (e.g. Co-oxide or a complex Fe-Ni-Cr oxide).
Titulo: Improved Redox Cycling Durability in Alternative Ni Alloy-Based SOFC Anodes

Sentencas: These oxide layers help suppress oxidation of the underlying nickel catalyst particles, preventing oxidation-induced volume changes/agglomeration, and thereby preserving the electron conducting pathways.
Titulo: Improved Redox Cycling Durability in Alternative Ni Alloy-Based SOFC Anodes

Sentencas: As such, the use of these alternative Ni-alloy based cermets significantly improves the redox stability of SOFC anodes.
Titulo: Improved Redox Cycling Durability in Alternative Ni Alloy-Based SOFC Anodes
